biotools.summary: KLIFS — Kinase–Ligand Interaction Fingerprints and Structures — is a structural kinase database focusing on how kinase inhibitors interact with their targets. The aim of KLIFS is to support (structure-based) kinase research through the systematic collection, annotation, and processing of kinase structures.
